definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: The geometry of the sans serif, all-caps typography provided that tie.
sentences.chinese: 幾何形狀的無襯，全帽印刷術提供配合。

sentences.english: Movable type printing was invented in the eleventh century.
sentences.chinese: 畢昇於1041年發明活字印刷術。

sentences.english: The invention of printing was a mile-stone in people progress.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的發明是人類進步的一個里程碑。

sentences.english: The invention of movable type printing was also a major breakthrough in the Chinese book history.
sentences.chinese: 活字印刷術的發明是書籍史上的又一偉大變革。

sentences.english: Imagine that the net represents a similar kind of transformation in our communications environment to that wrought by printing.
sentences.chinese: 試想，互聯網正在像印刷術一樣變革我們的通信環境。

sentences.english: The invention of printing was a mile-stone in human progress.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的發明是人類進步的一個里程碑。

sentences.english: The oldest printing technology in the world is china's engraving printing.
sentences.chinese: 世界最古老的印刷術，是中國先民發明的雕版印刷。

sentences.english: In the Sui and Tang dynasties, block technology was invented, which improved the speed of printing.
sentences.chinese: 隋唐時，發明了雕版印刷術，提高了印書的速度。

sentences.english: Our book are printed on paper. China invented paper and printing.
sentences.chinese: 我們的書印於紙上，而正是中國發明瞭紙和印刷術。

sentences.english: Which tells us printing capabilities don't change the design imperative.
sentences.chinese: 這告訴我們印刷術的發展不會強制改變設計的風格。

sentences.english: The invention of printing also meant that there was now a common language in print.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的發明使得書面語流行起來。

sentences.english: This fear dates back to at least the invention of movable type.
sentences.chinese: 這種擔心可以追溯到至少是活字印刷術的出現。

sentences.english: Theinvention of movable-type printing greatly promoted the cultural exchanges among countriesall over the world.
sentences.chinese: 活字印刷術的發明大大促進了世界各國的文化交流。

sentences.english: They were all printed using carved blocked.
sentences.chinese: 這可都是用雕版印刷術印製出來的。

sentences.english: The origin of print is controversial.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的誕生是有爭議的。

sentences.english: Its art of printing had withered into the production of stereotyped editions of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 它的印刷術淪落爲老套的孔子的作品。

definition: to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
